sentences.en: Cameron was a rich man, a patrician.
sentences.cn: 卡梅隆曾经是个有钱的贵族子弟。

sentences.en: Compared with the patrician Wallenbergs , Mr Ekholm cuts a bolder , more hands - on figure.
sentences.cn: 相教于具有贵族气息的瓦伦堡家族, 风险资产.

sentences.en: He was a lean, patrician gent in his early sixties.
sentences.cn: 他60岁出头，是位有着贵族气派的清瘦绅士。

sentences.en: He was reticent, patrician, bookish, urbane.
sentences.cn: 他沉默含蓄, 雍容华贵, 书生气十足,而又温文有礼.

sentences.en: Its patrician dignity was a picturesque sham.
sentences.cn: 它的贵族的尊严只是一套华丽的伪装.

sentences.en: The old patrician was buried in the family vault.
sentences.cn: 这位老贵族埋在家族的墓地里.

sentences.en: The speech was a summons back to the patrician values of restraint and responsibility ( Jonathan Alter )
sentences.cn: 这个演说旨在在贵族们心中呼唤克制和责任感的价值标准 ( 乔纳森·奥尔特 )

sentences.en: Though he patrician self - confidence , there was no snobbery in Roosevelt.
sentences.cn: 罗斯福有着出身贵族的 自信 满满, 但却毫无趋炎附势的丑恶嘴脸.

trans.tran_cn: 贵族的，显贵的，（相貌等）贵族似的

trans.tran_en: A patrician is a person who comes from a family of high social rank
